results.title: Pal Joey
results.creator_credit: Essex, George Sidney Productions, Fred Kohlmar and George Sidney
results.brief_description: Pal Joey, starring Frank Sinatra, Kim Novak and Rita Hayworth, is strong, funny entertainment based on a novel by John O’Hara. It features 14 songs from Rodgers and Hart including “The Lady is a Tramp”, “Bewitched, Bothered and Bewildered” and “My Funny Valentine”. Sinatra is an out of heel nightclub singer, Joey Evans, who plays the field with women. He is ideal as the irreverent, glib Joey.

results.title: Paisa
results.creator_credit: Organizzazione Film Internazionali, Foreign Film Productions and Roberto Rossellini
results.brief_description: Spoken in Italian dialogue with English subtitles. Covering the period from the Allied landings in Sicily in 1943 to the Liberation in 1945, Paisa is a film in six episodes. Each deals with a different aspect of the war in Italy; from the personal, (a drunken G.I. visits a prostitute and fails to recognise her as the young girl with whom he’d fallen in love only months earlier), to the field of battle itself, (brutal partisan warfare in Florence and the marshlands of the Po Delta). Following on from “Rome, Open City”, this was Rossellini’s second great neo-realist work and is one of the peak’s of film history. Stars Carmela Sazio, Robert Ban Loon, Dots M. Johnson, Maria Michi, Gar Moore, Harriet White, Renzo Avanzo, Bill Tubbs, Dale Edmonds.

results.title: Oz: A Rock 'n' Roll Road Movie
results.creator_credit: Count Features, Chris Lofven and Lyne Helms
results.brief_description: An Australian rock movie fable. Dorothy’s teenage quest in the Australia of the 70’s is a modern parable set to Ross Wilson’s music. With three weird friends who alternate between being pals and making passes, Dorothy sets out to find the answer to fame and fortune’s riddle at the hands of the wonderful wizard.

results.title: Outrageous fortune
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Interscope communications, Ted Field, Robert W. Cort and Arthur Hiller
results.brief_description: A madcap comedy involving a menage a trois and espionage. Two actresses who don’t get along with each other, Sandy (Bette Midler) and Lauren (Shelley Long) find out they are both dating the same man, Michael (Peter Coyote). All hell breaks loose when they discover that Michael is a spy working for a foreign government and that he has implicated them both in his schemes. Cast includes Robert Prosky, John Schuck, George Carlin.

results.title: Outland
results.creator_credit: The Ladd Company, Richard Roth and Peter Hyams
results.brief_description: On Io, the innermost moon of Jupiter, the volcanic landscape is desolate. For the Con-Am 27 mining colony, populated by misfits and losers, it is home. Violence bubbles benath the surface, ready to explode. Federal District Marshall, William T. O’Niel, (Sean Connery), is sent to investigate the grisly, frenzied deaths amongst the miners, and must struggle alone in the pursuit of truth. This is a grim view of the future, where productivity takes precendence over humanity.

results.title: Out of Africa [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Mirage Enterprises and Sydney Pollack
results.brief_description: Meryl Streep stars as Karen Blixen whose love affair with Africa began when she and her husband Baron Von Blixen (Klaus-Maria Brandauer) went to Kenya in 1914. Despite her disastrous marriage and the failure of her coffee plantation, her passion for Africa never died. Robert Redford is cast as her lover, Denys Finch-Hatton. Based on the books of Isak Dinesen (Karen Blixen’s pen name) “Out of Africa”, “Shadows on the grass” and “Letters from Africa” by Isak Dinesen; “Isak Dinesen: the life of a storyteller” by Judith Thurman; “Silence will speak” by Errol Trzebinski. Her powers of observation and gift for storytelling revealed the empathy she felt for the people of Kenya and her attraction to the land. (Academy awards 1986: Best Picture, Best Director, Best Adapted Screenplay, Best Cinematography, Best Original Score (John Barry), Best Art Direction and Best Sound)

results.title: Our town
results.creator_credit: Principal Artists, Sol Lesser and Sam Woods
results.brief_description: Thorton Wilder’s Pulitzer Prize-winning play was adapted to the screen, bringing to life an array of wonderful characters played by an impressive cast. Set in Grover’s Corner, New Hampshire, the typical American small-town of the early 1900’s is vividly recreated. Frank Craven as the narrator takes us on a “peephole” tour where we are given a simple yet dramatic account of what goes on in the lives of people from childhood to courtship; from birth to death. A young William Holden and Martha Scott in her first screen appearance, are the focal characters. Sam Wood’s techniques: a series of dazzling dissolves, evocative lighting and effective montages capture the essence of the period, so much so, that “Our Town” has become a cinema classic to be treasured in the hearts of film lovers.

results.title: Our daily bread
results.brief_description: ‘Our Daily Bread’ forms part of Vidor’s ‘Back to the Land’ trilogy, which also includes ‘The Stranger Returns’ (1933) and ‘The Wedding Night’ (1935). In his book on filmmaking, Vidor claims that he was developing a style that would integrate a ‘dramatic entertaining storyline’ with the ‘realism and credibility of a Flaherty-type documentary’. This film represents the height of the process. It tells the story of a young couple, Mary and John Sims, who are forced by the Depression to accept ownership of a bankrupt farm. With the help of a local Swedish farmer, they turn the dusty tract of land into a blooming spread and gradually a co-operative community establishes itself, in which support is mutual and money is not needed. The irrigation set piece which provides the film’s climax is justly famous. In 1935, the film was distributed under the title ‘The Miracle of life’ according to AMPAS records. The film opens with an interview with King Vidor recorded by David Shepard in the 1980s. ‘Our Daily Bread’ is followed by 2 short films, anonymously produced by Irving Thalberg at MGM in support of the re-election of the conservative party at the Californian gubernatorial elections. Cast includes Karen Morley, Tom Keene, Barbara Pepper, Addison Richards and John Qualen.

results.title: Othello
results.creator_credit: Dakota Films, Imminent Films, Luc Roeg, David Barron and Oliver Parker
results.brief_description: Othello: an intoxicating mix of love, sexual passion and the deadly power of jealousy. Riddled with jealousy and twisted with racial hatred, Iago (Kenneth Branagh) schemes and plots his way to torturing the love of Othello (Laurence Fishburne) and Desdemona (Irene Jacob). In a visually stunning and superbly acted masterpiece, Othello tells the most passionate tale of love and betrayal of all time.

results.title: Othello
results.brief_description: This magnificent film was shot on location throughout Europe and North Africa with a multinational cast and crew. Producer/director Orson Welles plays Othello and considered it to be one of his best films. Sadly, the film was believed to be lost for over thirty years. Finally, the original nitrate negative was tracked down and using today’s most innovative techniques, the film has been restored frame by frame to its original 91 minute director’s cut. Now this film is finally accessible to whole new generations of movie audiences.
